comment._content:
As the arches crept closer many people wondered how Bradfield was able to them falling into the harbour? “The erection of the Bridge has been achieved by a scheme bold and unique ..The main arch was erected by cantilevering out from each shore, the structure being held back by 128 wire cables attached at the tops of the end posts..” and fed through 'U' shaped anchor tunnels. “The anchor tunnels were to consist of two shafts 10 ft. x 6 ft. interconnected by two semi-circular tunnels sunk to a depth of about 120 feet below ground level.” 

- Quotes from uncovered and unpublished transcripts of Bradfield's radio speeches.
